column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $2$2$5$"I was on 0.5 mg (1/2 milligram) 2x daily of regular Xanax for 15 years for panic attacks and anxiety disorder. It worked wonderfully and I had a very good quality of life with it. I had a job
column3: got out of the house daily and lived my life much more normally. Suddenly last month
column4: my psychiatrist of 20 years decided he no longer likes to prescribe regular xanax anymore. Well I had a very bad anxiety relapse when he prescribed me Xanax Extended Release 1 mg one time per day instead. It was horrible!! It felt like I didn't even take my xanax and I had waves of normalcy mixed with horrendous rolling anxiety and intermittent panic attacks daily

column1: What I didn't know was that it was only giving me .25 mg at a time 4 times per day. Well I was used to the 1/2 of a milligram 2 times per day which was much stronger. People with anxiety or panic disorder notice every subtle detail and bodily change
column2: so I started panicking when I felt like they weren't working. My anticipatory anxiety shot through the roof and I felt panicked for the past month. It was like a roller coaster ride!

column1: I told my Dr. to please keep me on the original dosage of regular xanax that I was once taking and he refused and said XR is just as effective. He wouldn't listen to me even though I was on it for 15 years and never had to raise my dose. It seems now that all the doctors are too afraid of the feds
column2: they are cracking down and no longer prescribing regular xanax. I quit my job because I could no longer function and didn't even feel calm enough to drive my car anymore because the anxiety was so great.

column1: I guess these doctors washed their hands with people like me because they are afraid of the government. Sometimes patients know what works better than the doctors and they should listen to us.
My quality of life went down the tubes until I read on the internet a few days ago
column2: that if I cut one of these tablets in half a 1/2 milligram (my old dose) immediately is dispensed throughout the b"
65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I've taken it for about 38 years and it still works great. I only had to increase the dose once.!
75 or over on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$4$5$I've had Panic/Anxiety Disorder for most of my life
column3: long before they had a name for it.  I see a psychiatrist and I've only had good results with Xanax XR. I have taken Xanax XR twice a day for years.  In all that time I  have only gone up by one .5mg.  I currently take .5 mg in morning and 1 mg around 7 p.m. according to my doctors instructions. I spent 18 years housebound with agoraphobia because I wouldn't take any meds to help me.  Big mistake on my part.  My best advise to anyone considering taking Xanax is if you have a psychiatrist you trust
column4: do so and do not pay attention to any horror stories about Xanax XR that you see online. Some of us because of the circumstances of life or our biological makeup
column6: may need extra help. If you have any questions about
column7: save them for your doctor.  The only minus is you may feel a little sedated for the first 7 to 10 days.  I did because I'm very sensitive to most medicines because I metabolize them quickly. Final word...Xanax XR literally saved my life.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $4$4$4$I will say I originally took regular Xanax
column3: as opposed to the xr.  Initially
column4: it was very effective
column5: but it didn't last as long as I needed.  I needed a medication that was longer lasting.  Xanax xr is that medication.  I'm noticing many people commenting on this medication claiming they take it three times a day.  That doesn't make any sense.  The whole reason for this is so you don't have to dose three times a day. If you just have an occasional panic attack
column6: you would definitely benefit more from the traditional Xanax. It works strongly and quickly.  But it doesn't linger like other benzos like klonopin. I really think I'm going to go back to klonopin. I took that a few years ago and found it effective
column8: for some strange reason put me on Xanax. Klonopin is a strong
column9: long acting medication that works very well.  Xanax xr works but it's very expensive as compared to klonopin. But that's just my opinion.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I have bipolar depression and severe anxiety. I had regular Xanax for as-needed use but I didn't feel it really helped and never understood how people get addicted to it. It got so bad recently that I constantly felt like I was having a heart attack. I felt extreme irritation
column3: rage
column4: panic. My Psych switched me to Xanax XR and after the very first pill I felt.....NORMAL. I could actually enjoy my children again. The chest pain/discomfort left immediately. I feel pretty tired in the afternoon but I'll take that over how badly I was feeling. I give this drug an A+ and am SO grateful for it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years$5$5$5$It stops my panic attacks immediately. It is the most effective medication I have ever taken for my anxiety and panic!

45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $5$5$5$I currently take 1 mg. XR one or two times a day.  The 'classic' beneficial effects of Xanax are all there. Onset: 30 minutes after swallowing. From that moment it feels like a 0.5 mg. immediate release tab but the effects last a good 8 hours. (If you're familiar with immediate release Xanax tabs then you know the effects of those come & leave within 2 hours). Xanax XR still carries the typical side effects of immediate release Xanax: very vivid dreams
column3: slight disinhibition and brief moments of forgetfulness during the day. Overall an A+ plus though
column4: I prefer it over it over Valium.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have daily anxiety and was on ativan for a while and while I loved the ativan I was looking for something longer acting - my psychiatrist tried me on Xanax XR .05mg. For me
column3: this drug is a God send. In the beginning when I first starting taking it I did notice some slight dizzyness and 'weird' feelings but I stuck with it and once it regulated in my system (about 3-4 weeks) I feel totally normal and calm on it with zero side effects. I have since upped my dose to the 1mg Xanax XR twice daily if I need it
column4: but some days I only take one pill to get me through the day and deal with the anxiety at night since I'm home and then take a pill in the morning like normal. My advice would be to start it on the lowest dose and work your way up. Also be aware that Xanax XR does sometimes interact with other meds so check to see if it interferes with anything else you're taking or will take in the future.

65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I take it for Tinnitus which is ear noise from ear damage or perceived noise that they say comes for the brain. Sleep at night even with sleep machine(gives off different sounds to help one sleep)was very tough at times due to level of ear noise. Xanax generic .5 mg does help but due to the additive effect of Xanax I break it up if noise goes down after two nights of taking .5 mg I break it in half and take .25 mg till noise level gets back up to say a 8-9 on 10 scale. I fear the additive effects of Xanax so I try to keep the amount down till the noise starts to really get on my nerves before I take the .5mg only at night just before bed time. I do wake up feeling fine wish they would find some cure for Tinnitus maybe one day they will. Bad enough to be have some hearing loss but to add the Tinnitus on top of that is sure not much fun at any age.

16$Condition: Panic Disorder$3/24/2013 5:21:01 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$1$4$I had severe panic attacks and was a mess. I hate taking medication but was finally at a point where I was willing to do about anything. So, my psychiatrist prescribed me Xanax Xr 1mg 3 times per day and sublingual, very fast acting Xanax (Niravam) for use as well. It all did work to bring my anxiety down and if I took enough of it, it would finally break through the horrible panic attacks. However, and it is a BIG however, if you are deciding to take this drug or are recently on it, PLEASE look for an alternative. Seven years later and mostly anxiety free, I decided to taper off. The withdrawal is horrific. There are truly no words to describe how debilitating it is. PLEASE investigate withdrawal yourself. Do an online search for The Ashton Manual and you will understand. I have missed 2 months of work now and thankfully I own my own company so I can do this but it is not without intense symptoms and so much suffering...thousands of dollars in medical bills and most importantly a loss of being able to live a normal life. Withdrawal is not short term...some effects may last years. Please just really consider this. I hope my review will spare someone else what I am going through.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$5$5$I was diagnosed with a panic/anxiety disorder approximately 8 yrs ago. I have tried every type of drug possible to calm me down & nothing worked. Finally
column3: after seeing a psychiatrist he prescribed the regular xanax 1.0mg (3 per day). As
column4: a worry wart that I am
column5: I refused to take 3 a day for the fear of dependancy. I would only take 1 per day & at the most 1 1/2 per day
column6: which did help with the calming. Then about 3 months ago he decided to try the xanax xr 3mg per day. After a week of that
column7: I found I was so sleepy! I went from climbing the walls to sleeping all the time. The dose was way to much for me. So
column8: after the 1st month he lowered it to 2mg per day & so far it has been much better. As we all know these kind of meds can become addictive & that was just another thing I had to worry about
column9: but I finally tried to use the power of my mind to NOT let myself get addicted to them
column10: and I also look at it this way. If I can live close to a somewhat normal life again instead of being a figity hermit
column11: then I am all for it. So far I can say that I am not 100% my normal self
column12: but this is the closest I have been to it in the last 8yrs! I would definetly try it
column13: if you got anxiety & don't worry about the addictiveness. If you got a good dr. that will watch you closely & that you are not abusing them
column14: I think you will be fine! Life is to short to not enjoy it like you once did
column15: so I say give it a shot & try it. If someone would've told me they had panic/anxiety attks 10+ yrs ago
column16: I would've thought they were crazy! Trust me
column19: & I don't wish them on anyone. But
column20: I am VERY thankful that I have finally found something to take the edge off!!

column1: 64$Condition: Panic Disorder$12/1/2009 8:19:24 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$1$5$"I have taken Xanax for years. Yes
column2: it was my miracle pill. I was able to function in ways I hadnt been able to before. BUT my experience took a turn for the worse. I ended up in the hospital twice in one week because I had seizures due to lowering my dose. I became highly addicted. Because of the seizures my doctor decided I should try to stop completely. Weaning off of course but I might as well have gone cold turkey. The withdrawl symptoms are horrible. I couldnt sleep
column3: eat
column4: think clearly
column5: i was throwing up all the time. My body hurt. I was frustrated. My anxiety was ten times worse than it had ever been. Take my advice
column7: find another alternative. Xanax will ruin your life in the long run. I have been off Xanax for over 2 months now and still experiece horrible side affects. I have terrible headaches EVERYDAY. I still feel so sick to my stomach all the time and usually end up throwing up. I have researed it over and over again. This can last for up to 18 months. I have been unemployed throughout this process because i cant seem to leave my house. it has ruined me. Coming back from this is so hard. im doing my best. If i had known that i would go through all of this I NEVER would have taken it in the first place. If you HAVE to have something try Klonopin. (not sure if i spelled that right) it is so much better for you. its in the same family of xanax but not so addictive. it gives you the same benefits. i just want everyone to know that xanax is horrible. these educated doctors who prescribe it are wrong

column1: Its not worth it...just my opinion but seriously think of the long term affects first. "

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$5$5$I have been using the 2mg XR for anxiety/panic attacks for almost 4 years now. I am greatful for this drug; I feel comfortable in large crowds unlike before. I feel like I am relaxed throughout the day
column3: and don't worry as much as before I started taking this drug. There have been a few times when my script has lapsed before my regular doctor's visit
column4: and just for the few days of not taking it I haven't really experienced any serious side effects. I used to grind my teeth at night and constantly waking up through the night with my fists clinched up
column5: or just not being able to sleep at all. Overall
column7: not always feeling anxious or panicing about the daily grind at work. I work in a restuarant
column8: and was always getting stressed very easily. This drug has turned my life around for me. I also suffer from chronic migraines triggered by stress
column9: this has also helped keep my stress level down to help prevent the frequency of those migraines. As with any drug
column10: this is not for everyone. It works for me.

93$Condition: Other$7/23/2008 3:48:25 PM$Reviewer: Milo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have generalized anxiety disorder and have been on benzodiazepine therapy for 25 years now. What I like about Xanax XR compared to some other drugs in this class is that it stays in the system, continuously working all day, so I don't have to worry about taking my next dose on time, for example if I'm stuck on a delayed flight. The downside is that since I have been on these medications for so long, my psychiatrist (a specialist in psycho-pharmacology) has told me I will need to take this for life. That's fine with me; I look at it just like medication for diabetes or high blood pressure. Anyway, that would be the case with any benzodiazepine. I'm functioning well and sleeping well, taking 4-5 mg. per day for several years now.

99$Condition: Other$4/30/2008 5:34:47 PM$Reviewer: Xanax, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$I HIGHLY discourage any person from using this drug. Regardless of how anxious you may feel or if you have panic attacks, DON'T take it. I was on it for 6 months when prescribed by my family medicine doctor for occassional anxiety; I later went to the head phycologist at a nationally renound hospital in Washington. He is a lead prof in the School of Medicine, Phycology department. My new doctor spends 1 full day of class lecture on Xanax alone, and why NOT to prescribe it! This is serious...I attempted to stop taking the medication; only to find you have a serious risk of having a seizure and cannot stop cold turkey. The withdrawls are HORRIBLE, and you must wean yourself off Xanax! Because I was only on it for 6 months I went from 4pm/day to 2mg/day for 1 week, 1mg/day for 1 week, then .5mg/day for the last week and still had serious withdrawls. My doctor said patients who are on Xanax for longer periods of time, 2 years+, it can take them up to a year to get off it! And you can't rebound or relapse, you'll do nothing but hurt yourself even more! Even if you do take it to get rid of anxiety, it will get worse because your body becomes quickly dependant and immune to it, requiring higher dosages.I do not blog or post online, but I had to spread the word. I am an honors students, very stable, no drug addictions or problems, just a normal guy; so those who are prone to relapse or abuse Xanax, BE AWARE. Bottom line; in no circumstance take Xanax, if you're on it currently the best of luck getting off! Do as you wish, but thought I'd let you in on a little secret.
